name: Acute Aortic Dissection with Malperfusion Syndrome
chief_complaint: Tearing chest pain radiating to the back
physical_findings: Pulse deficit in left radial artery
treatment: Immediate blood pressure control with IV beta-blockers
prognosis: Guarded - mortality rate >50% without prompt surgical intervention
description: A life-threatening condition where a tear forms in the aortic intima, allowing blood to flow between the layers of the aortic wall. This case is complicated by malperfusion of vital organs due to compromised blood flow through branching arteries.
multiple_choice: Acute Aortic Dissection with Malperfusion Syndrome
